intro: Scorzonera incisa, commonly known as the common scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is notable for being tuberous and fleshy, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Scorzonera incisa is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
